column5: I think a day with Johnny Knoxville would be hilarious, musically I've already met my favourite band (from Sweden In Flames) but I also think meeting the tragically hip or Gord Downie would be awesome  Lucky you! Great and original band.........."Soundtrack to your escape" has spent many an hour blaring thru my trucks speakers!!  Cant tell you how many times ive listened to "My Sweet Shadow" on repeat lol  While were on musicians of this genre (sort of)........You may be the only one to recognize my picks:  Mark Morton (Lamb of God lead guitar) Davey Havok (unusual frontman of AFI) Adam D (Killswitch guitarist)
Definitely this one  https://www.facebook.com/pages/Fishing-Models/248326161847818
1370252_714703625209822_1949325514_n.jpg Definitely this one  https://www.facebook.com/pages/Fishing-Models/248326161847818    Nice pair---and the fish look good too!!
If you could spend a day with a celeb. who is it?   I got to hang with my celeb last fall for a few days.   Me pop an I.. My bestest friend.

So I have been thinking of it from the day this thread was posted and its been hard to think of one. I have been torn like others here on celebs from the board, fishing world hockey music NASCAR and more. Like Brian just posted my father is my first choice but its for celebs not our idols or people we look up to that makes my choice so hard.  I guess I would have to say Pat McAfee he is the punter from the Indianapolis colts he is on the bob and Tom show and is funny has snot. He has such a willingness for life and a huge child like eagerness to explore every adventure he can that I think taking him out musky fishing would be crazy with excitement.  I have been lucky enough to share my boat and other boats with so many in the OFC family it has been a great time out there with them.

Since you put it that way,,  Dale Sr,if he was alive. Fun,outdoorsman. Fished and hunted..God rest his soul.  Jr would be next in line. Maybe after a days fishing,I could teach him how to turn right.LOL
Joni Mitchell
The guy from the Maytag commercials , he looks bored as hell , may as well take him fishing .
The guy from the Maytag commercials , he looks bored as hell , may as well take him fishing .

Hey Manitou, I met the 1st guy from the Maytag ad's; Gordon Jump (from WKRP TV fame) and man he was one funny person!  It was just a fluke and a 1 x 1 talk too.  Yeah folks the whole idea of the post was someone in the spotlight that you think you would have a great day with, learn something from and or teach them something.  So far the replies have been great so please keep them coming.  For now I'm sticking with my answer from before...
Marissa tomei. Nuff said  Al lindner if she bailed on me.
Marissa tomei. Nuff said  George Costanza? Is that you?
George Costanza? Is that you? hahahha

Hey Manitou, I met the 1st guy from the Maytag ad's; Gordon Jump (from WKRP TV fame) and man he was one funny person!  It was just a fluke and a 1 x 1 talk too.  Yeah folks the whole idea of the post was someone in the spotlight that you think you would have a great day with, learn something from and or teach them something.  So far the replies have been great so please keep them coming.  For now I'm sticking with my answer from before...   second lonely guy   In 1989, Jump replaced Jesse White as the highly recognized spokesman for Maytag. White had originated the role of the serviceman who feels lonely because the company's appliances are so reliable that owners never call for help.
Dion Phanuf!
I would pay to watch that 1 on 1
Dion Phanuf! You spelled pylon wrong!
Dion Phanuf! Perfect then i'll take Elisha

I'm not big on elebs either, but I hear Bobby Orr is a pretty good fisherman and he's just got a book out so that should be quite enjoyable.  George Dubya?? what a nightmare that would be. Probably get a better response from talking to your outboard!

I'd have to say Paul McCartney. Always been a big fan. Besides him, Stompin' Tom would have been high on my list as well. I don't know why I picked two musicians. I like music but there's lots of things that I enjoy more. Oh well. I guess that they've left a big impression on me.
I don't think that was Lew showing a smile.  It's like a baby with gas but you think it's a smile...  Sorry, I just had to Lew...
Not big on celebs, my enjoyment is the look on a kids face catching his first fish, that kid is my celeb
For those of you that don"t think Lew ever smiles     We can arraign that if you would like  LOL Phil, I appreciate the thought, but any place that rocks is rocking too much for me!
I think Lew has gas in that pic, no way he's smilin!
If the wife sees this.... Babe Ruth  If she doesn't Jessica Beil
My pick would be Ted Nugent.
Eliza Dushku
Al Lindner....
Gees  for me its Mariko Izumi
Tough one, I think it would be Steven Wright, Louis Black, George Carlin (if he was still around), Stephen Colbert, Jon Stewart, Steve Martin, or Richard Dawkins.  And of course anyone on this board.

Tough one, I think it would be Steven Wright, Louis Black, George Carlin (if he was still around), Stephen Colbert, Jon Stewart, Steve Martin, or Richard Dawkins.  And of course anyone on this board.  That's a good selection of people, Christopher. It tells me that you're more cerebral than most and at your age, that's saying a lot.

Tough one, I think it would be Steven Wright, Louis Black, George Carlin (if he was still around), Stephen Colbert, Jon Stewart, Steve Martin, or Richard Dawkins.  And of course anyone on this board.  What---such a long list and Rob Ford still didn't make it??
I'd take a day fishing with Ron White!
Matt Groening.  I want to tell him to quit following me around and stealing my ideas.
Stewart and Carlin are great picks, I'd add Bill Hicks as well.  But John Ratzenberger's gotta top the list...not even sure if he's still around??
Almost met him a few years ago when I worked for the city but the day he was supposed to come out it was 50+ with the humidity. I think he would have melted.

Tough one, I think it would be Steven Wright, Louis Black, George Carlin (if he was still around), Stephen Colbert, Jon Stewart, Steve Martin, or Richard Dawkins.  And of course anyone on this board. I like the cut of your jib.  I would like to add Christopher Hitchens
My pick would be Ted Nugent. You mean the chicken hawk war mongering draft dodger?  I would use him as an anchor.  Has he ever hunted in a place where the animals were not fenced in?

You mean the chicken hawk war mongering draft dodger?  I would use him as an anchor.  Has he ever hunted in a place where the animals were not fenced in? Sorry for rattling your cage Grimace,a question was asked and that is my answer. Don't like it , too bad!
Sofia Vergara, I doubt I'd get much fishing done

.  Has he ever hunted in a place where the animals were not fenced in? Actually, he used to come up to the Muskokas on occasion in the spring for walleye opener a few decades back. Definitely a different sort of character. Kind of a media pioneer for the Robertsons
No question Neil Young. Others would include Al Lindner and I'd include Solopaddler on the list as well!!

A few years back I was at the Musky Odyssey in St. Catherines and was sitting in the auditorium listening to one of the speakers. I mentioned to the guy beside me that I purposely came to the show to listen to Gord Pyzer and was really looking forward to listening to his seminar.  I felt a tap on my shoulder and when I turned around to see who it was, it was Gord sitting behind me and he said I "I hope you enjoy what I have to say"  Really great guy for sure !!  That's a cool story! Would be a fun guy to talk to for sure.
Neil Young.  What an 'adventure' that would be.  He's not considered very approachable or nice, so getting him in a boat would be interesting to say the least....
Barry from storage wars. He seems like my kinda kook.  Though the Gord Pizer ice fishing idea sounds great.
Russell Peters or Brad Paisley  Somebody gona get a hurt,and it gona be me.LOL  Love that guy.  Hey dad,what fo dinner. Hod dogs.
Now your talking!! Keep on Rockin Steve!  S.
Big John Gillespie,man those Johnsonvilles look good!!!!  .lol. In all seriousness,as mentioned earlier fishing with good friends can't be beat either!!

I think a day with Johnny Knoxville would be hilarious, musically I've already met my favourite band (from Sweden In Flames) but I also think meeting the tragically hip or Gord Downie would be awesome
Mila Kunis, esp after she did that great interview with the guy who was super nervous. I think she has brains and would have some interesting things to say
Also Pavel Datsyuk, he loves fishing

Big John Gillespie,man those Johnsonvilles look good!!!!  .lol. In all seriousness,as mentioned earlier fishing with good friends can't be beat either!!  John was at my place a while back. We had a few beers, a bite to eat and laughed all the while. He's a hard working straight shooter and an all around good guy. Maybe the stars will align and we'll do it again soon. The door is always open.  As for the votes for me, I'm the farthest person away from being a celebrity but I cherish any time that I spend with old and new friends. That said....thanks for the votes.
Some may say yer over rated,some may say yer under rated. I say................   YER MY FRIEND.  Thats all that matters.

John was at my place a while back. We had a few beers, a bite to eat and laughed all the while. He's a hard working straight shooter and an all around good guy. Maybe the stars will align and we'll do it again soon. The door is always open.  As for the votes for me, I'm the farthest person away from being a celebrity but I cherish any time that I spend with old and new friends. That said....thanks for the votes. He looks as though he 'd be a lot of fun,if anything like the show!!
well, you can't argue Big John has the best opening music to his show.  he's actually quite fun and one of my favourite shows on WFN.
x 2 Hanging out with Mike, Rick, Doug, Joe and other like minded folks from the board for sure !
It would have to be Stephen Hawking, not that he really a celebrity.  Other than that, Brian, Wayne, Lew, and a whole bunch of others I've never met in person.

Lew, and a whole bunch of others I've never met in person.  Actually, you and I met and chatted for quite awhile at the Spring Fishing Show about 10 years ago, guess I don't leave much of a lasting impression
Lew, that's amazing.  I don't remember who I met last year, you can remember encounters 10 years ago.  I'm jealous of those who have memories like that.

Lew, that's amazing.  I don't remember who I met last year, you can remember encounters 10 years ago.  I'm jealous of those who have memories like that.  But I can't remember what I had for breakfast this morning LOL

Actually, you and I met and chatted for quite awhile at the Spring Fishing Show about 10 years ago, guess I don't leave much of a lasting impression No, no, I meant I 've met you, Brian, Wayne, Joey, Maureen, TJ, etc,  just all the others I haven't met yet.  I remember you quite clearly at the show along with a couple others.  Fingers and brain aren't quite in unison...
But I can't remember what I had for breakfast this morning LOL   i guess it didn't leave much of a lasting impression on ya - which is likely a good thing.

Got to spend a whole weekend on Lake Temagami with these guys, from breakfast to late night campfire. My job was to drive my boat around to show them some key spots and then make sure I stayed off camera  Pretty hard not to be impressed by the guy on the left. As down to earth as they come
The man him self,and the other man as well.That must of been one heck of a fun weekend!!!!!!

There are so many here I still need to meet and fish with is why I said Celeb.  Someone you want to meet and spend a day with that you normally have no chance of doing so with.  I have met and fished with a few of you but with my new found free time I plan to get out a lot more!  I said Sheryl Crow for a few reasons...   Have you seen her "Steve McQueen" video?

A girl I know looks just like a young Sheryl crow. It's hard to not stare. A pleasure to know. Here names not Laura is it?  LOL! I knew a Laura growing up who looks very similar to her too. PS, introduce me please...

^^^^  What Terry said, I have zero interest in celebrities.  I've had 70 different members of this board in my boat over the last 12 years or so and have had a great day with every single on of them.  And yes, I've fished with Roy too and I'd recommend it to anyone For those of you that don"t think Lew ever smiles    If I was able to? Anyone from the board would be a big enough star for me!   We can arraign that if you would like

Hey all.  So if you could spend a day with a current (living) celebrity just to "hang out and shoot the poop with" who would it be and why?  Me, Sheryl Crow (good looking, good music and I bet enjoys hunting/fishing)
I've already done it many times.. spending a day with good old Roy  !
Chris Hadfield
Christopher Walken, just so I could listen to him talk
A girl I know looks just like a young Sheryl crow.  It's hard to not stare.  A pleasure to know.  I pick fishing with moosebunk because of his passion for the sport.
Pam Anderson, perhaps I could 'talk' some sense into her.   I'd take her hunting and fishing and show her a good field to table spread.  Going to have to fix this world.  Entropy

Probably johnny depp or maybe mr putin. However my good friend fished with bush jr and it was no fun at all. The pics are cool though. Id pick depp just cause he seens down to learn and very entertaining. Plus im sure my better half would prepare a meal of a life time

Non fishing would be a really tough choice.  In my impressionable and idealistic years I have had the privilege of meeting and/or speaking with the likes of Robertson Davies, Farley Mowat, the Dalai Lama, and McLuhan just before his stroke. All individuals of considerable intellect and insight. Pretty hard to find better intellectual company. Very much the opposite of some of my classmates now sitting in Parliament. They're not worth wasting lead or ink to acknowledge them. I'm not so much of an idealist any more, and there are few in this world that impress me any longer. Musically I would love to talk with Ian Anderson Only others that would interest me would be the likes of Tom Hanks or Robin Williams. Fellas who can put me in stitches.
Rob Ford. Only because the last time I met him he stole my fav crack pipe and I want it back

I pick fishing with moosebunk because of his passion for the sport.  Shucks Brother Glen...  GBW did post "celeb" though, not lunatic.  It's probably called obsession too, not passion. Do loves me some fishing bud, thanks.  Maybe one day we'll get that chance to share a boat and I'll talk your ears off.   Really have no idea off the top of my head which celebrity I'd wanna hang out with so maybe I'll go with Roy too, if Wayne gives it the OK.
I'm going with Jase Robertson myself! Catfish and dynamite..... Why not!

Quite frankly celebrities boor me as they are mostly shallow people who have done nothing but  ACT and look PRETTY.I would rather spend my time with a VICTORIA CROSS winner or a MEDAL of HONOR winner any time or any other military medal for heroism.  vance

1) Betty White without a doubt! I think she has an amazing sense of humor!  2) Justin Bieber so I could choke some sense and respect into him.  3) Rick Mercer, straight up honest approach to things and he isn't afraid to have a good laugh at his own expense!
take a day with my friends over a celeb any day

^^^^  What Terry said, I have zero interest in celebrities.  I've had 70 different members of this board in my boat over the last 12 years or so and have had a great day with every single on of them.  And yes, I've fished with Roy too and I'd recommend it to anyone

I don't know if this counts but I'd probably take a day ice fishing with Gord Pyzer up north over any meet and greet with an A list celebrity.  The guy just seems super cool and I'd walk away with a ton of knowledge of something I love but hardly have the time to learn.
If I was able to? Anyone from the board would be a big enough star for me!

I don't know if this counts but I'd probably take a day ice fishing with Gord Pyzer up north over any meet and greet with an A list celebrity.  The guy just seems super cool and I'd walk away with a ton of knowledge of something I love but hardly have the time to learn.  A few years back I was at the Musky Odyssey in St. Catherines and was sitting in the auditorium listening to one of the speakers. I mentioned to the guy beside me that I purposely came to the show to listen to Gord Pyzer and was really looking forward to listening to his seminar.  I felt a tap on my shoulder and when I turned around to see who it was, it was Gord sitting behind me and he said I "I hope you enjoy what I have to say"  Really great guy for sure !!
I fish with one all the time. Theres always someone saying they know him.  I say what about me?????

Celebrities to me "What do they fish for"  I would like to go with Al on one of those 2 week fishing a dozen lakes. Don't care if they are making movies just want to fish with the whole group day after day.
I fish with one all the time. Theres always someone saying they know him.  I say what about me????? now that was funny......lol
We all cant be    Legends
Russell Peters or Brad Paisley
